generated_for: Enterprise_C ISA-88/ISA-95 root policy tree (SUB, SUM, TFF, CHROM)

uns.name: Enterprise_C
uns.description: Enterprise root for Enterprise_C. Use this as the top-level UNS namespace for all data products, governance, and analytics. Maps to ISA‑95 Enterprise context (L4/L3) and provides the parent scope for ISA‑88 batch-capable process cells and units beneath it.

uns.name: Site1
uns.description: Site node for Site1. Represents the physical/organizational site in ISA‑95 (typically L3). This is the anchor for site-level scheduling, inventory, and performance reporting, and the parent scope for all Areas and Process Cells at the site.

uns.name: Bioprocessing
uns.description: Area node for Bioprocessing. Represents a functional production area in ISA‑95 (L2/L3 boundary). Use this level to group related unit operations, KPIs, and alarms across downstream processing (DSP) assets and to apply area-wide governance (naming, retention, quality rules).

uns.name: DSP_ProcessCell
uns.description: Downstream Processing (DSP) Process Cell. In ISA‑88, the Process Cell groups multiple Units that execute a coordinated set of batch and/or continuous steps. In ISA‑95, this aligns with L2 manufacturing control scope for DSP assets and procedures.

uns.name: sub
uns.description: SUB (Subculture) unit. Typically covers inoculum/seed expansion handoff into downstream steps. Captures run context (batch ID, lot, recipe), key setpoints/measurements, and event state. This node is the canonical UNS address for the unit’s operational data and context. It maps to ISA‑88 Unit and ISA‑95 Unit scope (L2). Historian binding: dbms='enterprise_c', table='sub_1'.

uns.name: equipment
uns.description: Equipment branch for this Unit. Use this subtree to model physical assets and equipment modules (ISA‑88 EquipmentModule) such as pumps, valves, sensors, skids, and controllers. Typical children could include asset identifiers, health/state, maintenance counters, and alarm summaries.

uns.name: procedures
uns.description: Procedural control branch (ISA‑88). Organizes the executable control model for the unit into Unit Procedures → Operations → Phases. Use this subtree to standardize batch semantics, capture phase timing, and map control/SCADA events into consistent UNS paths.

uns.name: prepare
uns.description: Unit Procedure 'prepare'. Represents a major stage of unit execution in ISA‑88. Typical intent: prepare = ready equipment/materials and verify preconditions Use children Operations/Phases to record detailed control steps, durations, and reasons for holds/stops.

uns.name: start
uns.description: Operation 'start'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.name: setpoints
uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: control
uns.description: Operation 'control'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.name: setpoints
uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: stop
uns.description: Operation 'stop'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: run
uns.description: Unit Procedure 'run'. Represents a major stage of unit execution in ISA‑88. Typical intent: run = execute the primary processing step(s) and collect critical process parameters Use children Operations/Phases to record detailed control steps, durations, and reasons for holds/stops.

uns.name: alarms

uns.name: cip
uns.description: Unit Procedure 'cip'. Represents a major stage of unit execution in ISA‑88. Typical intent: cip = clean/steam-in-place activities, post-run resets, and readiness for next batch Use children Operations/Phases to record detailed control steps, durations, and reasons for holds/stops.

uns.name: setpoints
uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms

uns.name: production
uns.description: Production operations branch (ISA‑95). Use for L3-facing production objects: schedule, performance, and material consumption. This is where MES-style reporting and planning interfaces typically read/write.

uns.name: schedule
uns.description: ProductionSchedule view. Store planned/active work orders, batch targets, start/end windows, and resource constraints for this unit. Link schedule items to batch IDs and recipe versions.

uns.name: performance
uns.description: ProductionPerformance view. Store throughput, yield, cycle time, OEE-style metrics, and downtime categorization for this unit. Use consistent reason codes and rollups by batch/run.

uns.name: material
uns.description: MaterialConsumption view. Store material genealogy, inputs/outputs, buffer lots, and consumption events. Link to lot numbers, COAs, and quality release status for end-to-end traceability.

uns.name: quality
uns.description: Quality operations branch (ISA‑95). Use for L3-facing quality objects: tests, specifications, and deviation management. This subtree supports compliance, release, and investigation workflows.

uns.name: tests
uns.description: QualityTests view. Store in-process and release test results, sample IDs, timestamps, methods, and pass/fail outcomes. Link results to batch/run context and measurement sources.

uns.name: specs
uns.description: Specifications view. Store target/spec limits and acceptance criteria (e.g., conductivity range, UV thresholds, pH). Prefer versioned specs tied to product and recipe version.

uns.name: deviations
uns.description: Deviations view. Store deviations, investigations, CAPAs, and exception events. Link each deviation to the relevant batch/phase, affected parameters, disposition, and approvals.

uns.name: sum
uns.description: SUM (Seed/Upstream Mix) unit. Represents media/buffer preparation or seed mixing prior to DSP. Use to track material genealogy, mixing parameters, holds, and quality release gates. This node is the canonical UNS address for the unit’s operational data and context. It maps to ISA‑88 Unit and ISA‑95 Unit scope (L2). Historian binding: dbms='enterprise_c', table='sum_1'.

uns.name: tff

It maps to ISA‑88 Unit and ISA‑95 Unit scope (L2). Historian binding: dbms='enterprise_c', table='tff_1'.

uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: stop
uns.description: Operation 'stop'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.name: setpoints
uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: cip
uns.description: Unit Procedure 'cip'. Represents a major stage of unit execution in ISA‑88. Typical intent: cip = clean/steam-in-place activities, post-run resets, and readiness for next batch Use children Operations/Phases to record detailed control steps, durations, and reasons for holds/stops.

uns.name: start
uns.description: Operation 'start'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.description: Operation 'stop'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.

uns.name: setpoints
uns.description: Phase category: setpoints. Store target values/recipes here (e.g., flow rate, pressure limits, CV targets). Prefer versioned recipe references and capture who/what changed a setpoint and when.

uns.name: measurements
uns.description: Phase category: measurements. Store time-series signals and calculated KPIs here (e.g., UV, pH, TMP, conductivity, yield). Use consistent units and include quality flags for sensor health.

uns.name: alarms
uns.description: Phase category: alarms. Store event/alert streams here (e.g., high TMP, low flow, UV spike). Include severity, acknowledge info, and links back to the active batch/phase for traceability.

uns.name: production
uns.description: Production operations branch (ISA‑95). Use for L3-facing production objects: schedule, performance, and material consumption. This is where MES-style reporting and planning interfaces typically read/write.

uns.name: schedule
uns.description: ProductionSchedule view. Store planned/active work orders, batch targets, start/end windows, and resource constraints for this unit. Link schedule items to batch IDs and recipe versions.

uns.name: performance
uns.description: ProductionPerformance view. Store throughput, yield, cycle time, OEE-style metrics, and downtime categorization for this unit. Use consistent reason codes and rollups by batch/run.

uns.name: material
uns.description: MaterialConsumption view. Store material genealogy, inputs/outputs, buffer lots, and consumption events. Link to lot numbers, COAs, and quality release status for end-to-end traceability.

uns.name: quality
uns.description: Quality operations branch (ISA‑95). Use for L3-facing quality objects: tests, specifications, and deviation management. This subtree supports compliance, release, and investigation workflows.

uns.name: tests
uns.description: QualityTests view. Store in-process and release test results, sample IDs, timestamps, methods, and pass/fail outcomes. Link results to batch/run context and measurement sources.

uns.name: specs
uns.description: Specifications view. Store target/spec limits and acceptance criteria (e.g., conductivity range, UV thresholds, pH). Prefer versioned specs tied to product and recipe version.

uns.name: deviations
uns.description: Deviations view. Store deviations, investigations, CAPAs, and exception events. Link each deviation to the relevant batch/phase, affected parameters, disposition, and approvals.

uns.name: chrom
uns.description: CHROM (Chromatography) unit. Represents column operations (equilibrate/load/wash/elute/strip). Use to track column ID, CVs, UV/cond/pH traces, fraction events, and yield/quality outcomes. This node is the canonical UNS address for the unit’s operational data and context. It maps to ISA‑88 Unit and ISA‑95 Unit scope (L2). Historian binding: dbms='enterprise_c', table='chrom_1'.

uns.name: equipment
uns.description: Equipment branch for this Unit. Use this subtree to model physical assets and equipment modules (ISA‑88 EquipmentModule) such as pumps, valves, sensors, skids, and controllers. Typical children could include asset identifiers, health/state, maintenance counters, and alarm summaries.

uns.name: procedures
uns.description: Procedural control branch (ISA‑88). Organizes the executable control model for the unit into Unit Procedures → Operations → Phases. Use this subtree to standardize batch semantics, capture phase timing, and map control/SCADA events into consistent UNS paths.

uns.name: prepare
uns.description: Unit Procedure 'prepare'. Represents a major stage of unit execution in ISA‑88. Typical intent: prepare = ready equipment/materials and verify preconditions Use children Operations/Phases to record detailed control steps, durations, and reasons for holds/stops.

uns.name: start
uns.description: Operation 'start'. Groups a set of Phases that achieve a specific objective within a Unit Procedure (ISA‑88). Typical meaning: start = initialization/bring-up; control = steady-state/regulation; stop = shutdown/transition. Use this node to summarize operation-level timing, status, and exceptions.
